title: Matteo Guendouzi among four Premier League players on final Golden Boy shortlist
text:

The final 20 players on the 2019 Golden Boy shortlist have been announced with three England stars making the cut.

The prestigious award is given out by Italian newspaper Tuttosport for the best player under 21 to be playing in the top tier of European football.

Juventus and Holland defender Matthjs de Ligt won the award in 2018, following in the footsteps of Lionel Messi and Kylian Mbappe.

An initial shortlist was announced earlier this year and has now been whittled down to a final 20 names.

Among the contenders are England youngsters Jadon Sancho, Mason Mount and Phil Foden.

(Image: Getty)

(Image: PA)

Sancho is continuing to shine with Borussia Dortmund while Mount has had a fine start to the season with Chelsea , and has been rewarded with a place in the England squad.

Manchester City youngster Foden is continuing to be made to wait for regular first-team action by Pep Guardiola.

Arsenal midfielder Matteo Guendouzi has also made the 20-man list, just a year after joining the club from Lorient.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

The other Premier League inclusion is Moise Kean, who is yet to score for Everton since his £27m move from Juventus this summer.

Atletico Madrid and Portugal youngster Joao Felix is among the favourites for the prize, having joined from Benfica in a £113m deal in the summer.

Other nominees include reported Manchester United target Erling Braut Haaland, Barcelona teenager Ansu Fati and last year's winner De Ligt.

description: England and Borussia Dortmund star Jadon Sancho has also been included on the final 20-man shortlist
